head.title: Playful Objects With an Argentine Flavor

hedline.hl1: Playful Objects With an Argentine Flavor

abstract.p: Work of Argentine designers is at MoMA shops; photos (S)

block.p: ''Destination: Buenos Aires,'' a collection of 39 objects by Argentine designers, produced through a collaboration between the Museum of Modern Art and the Museo de Arte Latinoamericano de Buenos Aires, will be available for sale at the MoMA shops starting today. The limited-edition jewelry, accessories, tableware and furnishings were created by 16 designers, including, from left, Leo Battistelli, Marcelo Mazza, Ingrid Gutman, Lola Goldstein and Pedro Reissig. The pieces include clay shakers ($22), top left, hand-glazed in the shape of animals by Ms. Goldstein, and Mr. Reissig's kangaroo leather desk organizer ($38), top right. Through March 11 at MoMA Design Stores, 44 West 53 Street, (212) 767-1050, and 81 Spring Street (Crosby Street), (646) 613-1367, or momastore.org.
